event.title: 1919, the New Jersey State Highway Commission built

data.event: In 1919, the New Jersey State Highway Commission built a new road that became part of the Lincoln Highway, an early plan to create a transcontinental highway.

event.title: was constructed on the west side of the Pennsylvania Railroad (now

data.event: The stretch was constructed on the west side of the Pennsylvania Railroad (now the Northeast Corridor) from near the northeast of Dow Avenue between Colonia and Iselin to Cedar Street in Menlo Park, to avoid two railroad crossings.
